alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 12:06AM EDT until March 27 at 7:41AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding occurs in the woodlands along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow almost doubles in volume compared to the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EDT Sunday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 6.6 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 02/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
